<hr><h1>GNE::Console Namespace Reference</h1>Functions for providing very basic console support, meant for use in the example and test programs, and in console-only servers using <a class="el" href="namespaceGNE.html">GNE</a>. 
<a href="#_details">More...</a>

<hr><a name="_details"></a><h2>Detailed Description</h2>
Functions for providing very basic console support, meant for use in the example and test programs, and in console-only servers using <a class="el" href="namespaceGNE.html">GNE</a>.
<p>
These functions's behavior is undefined when running in a Win32 application (not a Win32 console) project, or in any non-console environment.<br>
 Functions that have m prefixed on them mean "multithreaded," because they are thread safe. Functions with l prefixed on them mean "location," because they perform their operations starting at the given coordinates rather than the current cursor location. When one of these functions are called, the cursor is not returned to its original location (so you can't mix mprintf and mlprintf calls well).<br>
 The upper-left coordinate of the screen is (0,0). The lower-right coordinate of the window is (width-1,height-1). Use the function getConsoleSize(int*, int*) to find the width and height if possible. Note that the input functions are not thread-safe since there's only one keyboard to be used ;). It is okay, however, to be using the console output functions at the same time you are using the locatable input functions. If you are using the inputfunctions that do not take locations (like getString and gin), you cannot be doing output at the same time, since they will move the cursor's location. 
<p>
<hr><h2>Function Documentation</h2>
<a name="a20" doxytag="GNE::Console::getch"></a><p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="2" cellspacing="0" border="0">
  <tr>
    <td class="md">
      <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0">
        <tr>
          <td class="md" nowrap valign="top"> int GNE::Console::getch </td>
          <td class="md" valign="top">(&nbsp;</td>
          <td class="mdname1" valign="top" nowrap>&nbsp;          </td>
          <td class="md" valign="top">)&nbsp;</td>
          <td class="md" nowrap></td>
        </tr>

      </table>
    </td>
  </tr>
</table>
<table cellspacing=5 cellpadding=0 border=0>
  <tr>
    <td>
      &nbsp;
    </td>
    <td>

<p>
Returns the next character in the input, blocking if no character is ready to be returned.
<p>
You cannot use this call while an lgetstring is being processed, but you can use this while output is being written (getch does not echo to the screen). <dl compact><dt><b>
Returns: </b><dd>
the next character </dl><dl compact><dt><b>
See also: </b><dd>
<a class="el" href="namespaceGNE_1_1Console.html#a19">kbhit</a> , <a class="el" href="namespaceGNE_1_1Console.html#a25">lgetString</a> </dl>    </td>
  </tr>
</table>
<a name="a26" doxytag="GNE::Console::getString"></a><p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="2" cellspacing="0" border="0">
  <tr>
    <td class="md">
      <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0">
        <tr>
          <td class="md" nowrap valign="top"> int GNE::Console::getString </td>
          <td class="md" valign="top">(&nbsp;</td>
          <td class="md" nowrap valign="top">char *&nbsp;</td>
          <td class="mdname" nowrap>&nbsp; <em>str</em>, </td>

        <tr>
          <td></td>
          <td></td>

    </td>
  </tr>
</table>
<table cellspacing=5 cellpadding=0 border=0>
  <tr>
    <td>
      &nbsp;
    </td>
    <td>

<p>
Same as <a class="el" href="namespaceGNE_1_1Console.html#a25">lgetString</a>(int, int, char*, int), but uses the current cursor position as obtained from mgetpos for the positions.
<p>
<dl compact><dt><b>
See also: </b><dd>
<a class="el" href="namespaceGNE_1_1Console.html#a25">lgetString</a> , mgetpos </dl>    </td>
  </tr>
</table>
<a name="a17" doxytag="GNE::Console::initConsole"></a><p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="2" cellspacing="0" border="0">
  <tr>
    <td class="md">
      <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0">
        <tr>
          <td class="md" nowrap valign="top"> bool GNE::Console::initConsole </td>
          <td class="md" valign="top">(&nbsp;</td>
          <td class="md" nowrap valign="top">int(*&nbsp;</td>
          <td class="mdname1" valign="top" nowrap>&nbsp; <em>atexit_ptr</em>)(void(*func)(void))          </td>
          <td class="md" valign="top">)&nbsp;</td>
          <td class="md" nowrap></td>

      </table>
    </td>
  </tr>
</table>
<table cellspacing=5 cellpadding=0 border=0>
  <tr>
    <td>
      &nbsp;
    </td>
    <td>

<p>
Initalizes the console part of <a class="el" href="namespaceGNE.html">GNE</a>.
<p>
This may be called multiple times. Pass it your atexit function so the console will be shutdown automatically on program exit. <dl compact><dt><b>
Returns: </b><dd>
true if the console could not be initalized. </dl>    </td>
  </tr>
</table>
<a name="a19" doxytag="GNE::Console::kbhit"></a><p>

  </tr>
</table>
<table cellspacing=5 cellpadding=0 border=0>
  <tr>
    <td>
      &nbsp;
    </td>
    <td>

<p>
Returns non-zero if a key is waiting in the buffer to be received by getch.
<p>
You cannot use this call while an lgetstring is being processed. You can use this function while output is being displayed. <dl compact><dt><b>
See also: </b><dd>
<a class="el" href="namespaceGNE_1_1Console.html#a20">getch</a> , <a class="el" href="namespaceGNE_1_1Console.html#a25">lgetString</a> </dl>    </td>
  </tr>
</table>
<a name="a25" doxytag="GNE::Console::lgetString"></a><p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="2" cellspacing="0" border="0">
  <tr>
    <td class="md">
      <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0">
        <tr>
          <td class="md" nowrap valign="top"> int GNE::Console::lgetString </td>
          <td class="md" valign="top">(&nbsp;</td>
          <td class="md" nowrap valign="top">int&nbsp;</td>
          <td class="mdname" nowrap>&nbsp; <em>x</em>, </td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
          <td></td>
          <td></td>
          <td class="md" nowrap>int&nbsp;</td>
          <td class="mdname" nowrap>&nbsp; <em>y</em>, </td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
          <td></td>
          <td></td>
          <td class="md" nowrap>char *&nbsp;</td>
          <td class="mdname" nowrap>&nbsp; <em>str</em>, </td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
          <td></td>
          <td></td>
          <td class="md" nowrap>int&nbsp;</td>
          <td class="mdname" nowrap>&nbsp; <em>maxlen</em></td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
          <td></td>
          <td class="md">)&nbsp;</td>
          <td class="md" colspan="2"></td>
        </tr>

      </table>
    </td>
  </tr>
</table>
<table cellspacing=5 cellpadding=0 border=0>
  <tr>
    <td>
      &nbsp;
    </td>
    <td>

<p>
Gets input from the console.
<p>
This is a blocking call, because you cannot have multiple inputs at the same time, since there is no way for the user to choose which input to go to. Also when you use this call, no other threads can be using kbhit or getch. It is recommended that only one thread be in charge of input from the console. It is okay, however, to be using the console output functions at the same time you are using this function. When the user presses enter the input is complete. <dl compact><dt><b>
Parameters: </b><dd>
<table border=0 cellspacing=2 cellpadding=0>
<tr><td valign=top><em>str</em>&nbsp;</td><td>
a char* with size maxlen+1 where input will be stored. </td></tr>
<tr><td valign=top><em>maxlen</em>&nbsp;</td><td>
the maximum number of characters the user can input. </td></tr>
</table>
</dl><dl compact><dt><b>
Returns: </b><dd>
the length of the string returned, from 0 &lt;= x &lt;= maxlen </dl><dl compact><dt><b>
See also: </b><dd>
<a class="el" href="namespaceGNE_1_1Console.html#a19">kbhit</a> , <a class="el" href="namespaceGNE_1_1Console.html#a20">getch</a> </dl>    </td>
  </tr>
</table>
<a name="a28" doxytag="GNE::Console::mgetConsoleSize"></a><p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="2" cellspacing="0" border="0">
  <tr>
    <td class="md">
      <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0">
        <tr>
          <td class="md" nowrap valign="top"> void GNE::Console::mgetConsoleSize </td>
          <td class="md" valign="top">(&nbsp;</td>
          <td class="md" nowrap valign="top">int *&nbsp;</td>
          <td class="mdname" nowrap>&nbsp; <em>width</em>, </td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
          <td></td>
          <td></td>
          <td class="md" nowrap>int *&nbsp;</td>
          <td class="mdname" nowrap>&nbsp; <em>height</em></td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
          <td></td>
          <td class="md">)&nbsp;</td>
          <td class="md" colspan="2"></td>
        </tr>

      </table>
    </td>
  </tr>
</table>
<table cellspacing=5 cellpadding=0 border=0>
  <tr>
    <td>
      &nbsp;
    </td>
    <td>

<p>
Gets the size of the console, in character columns and character rows.
<p>
If x or y are -1, then the width and height are unable to be determined. The return values for this function may or may not change if the console window is resized. <dl compact><dt><b>
Parameters: </b><dd>
<table border=0 cellspacing=2 cellpadding=0>
<tr><td valign=top><em>width</em>&nbsp;</td><td>
integer where the number of columns is stored. </td></tr>
<tr><td valign=top><em>height</em>&nbsp;</td><td>
integer where the number of rows is stored. </td></tr>
</table>
</dl>    </td>
  </tr>
</table>
<a name="a29" doxytag="GNE::Console::mgetPos"></a><p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="2" cellspacing="0" border="0">
  <tr>
    <td class="md">
      <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0">
        <tr>
          <td class="md" nowrap valign="top"> void GNE::Console::mgetPos </td>
          <td class="md" valign="top">(&nbsp;</td>
          <td class="md" nowrap valign="top">int *&nbsp;</td>
          <td class="mdname" nowrap>&nbsp; <em>x</em>, </td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
          <td></td>
          <td></td>
          <td class="md" nowrap>int *&nbsp;</td>
          <td class="mdname" nowrap>&nbsp; <em>y</em></td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
          <td></td>
          <td class="md">)&nbsp;</td>
          <td class="md" colspan="2"></td>
        </tr>

      </table>
    </td>
  </tr>
</table>
<table cellspacing=5 cellpadding=0 border=0>
  <tr>
    <td>
      &nbsp;
    </td>
    <td>

<p>
Returns the current position of the cursor.
<p>
As an "m" prefixed function, this is safe to call from multiple threads, but note that if you are using functions that relocate the cursor at the same time this function is called, the "current position" probably will not be very helpful. It is best used when a single thread is doing console I/O.     </td>
  </tr>
</table>
<a name="a22" doxytag="GNE::Console::mlprintf"></a><p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="2" cellspacing="0" border="0">
  <tr>
    <td class="md">
      <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0">
        <tr>
          <td class="md" nowrap valign="top"> int GNE::Console::mlprintf </td>
          <td class="md" valign="top">(&nbsp;</td>
          <td class="md" nowrap valign="top">int&nbsp;</td>
          <td class="mdname" nowrap>&nbsp; <em>x</em>, </td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
          <td></td>
          <td></td>
          <td class="md" nowrap>int&nbsp;</td>
          <td class="mdname" nowrap>&nbsp; <em>y</em>, </td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
          <td></td>
          <td></td>
          <td class="md" nowrap>const char *&nbsp;</td>
          <td class="mdname" nowrap>&nbsp; <em>format</em>, </td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
          <td></td>
          <td></td>
          <td class="md" nowrap>...&nbsp;</td>
          <td class="mdname" nowrap>&nbsp;</td>
        </tr>
        <tr>
          <td></td>
          <td class="md">)&nbsp;</td>
          <td class="md" colspan="2"></td>
        </tr>

      </table>
    </td>
  </tr>
</table>
<table cellspacing=5 cellpadding=0 border=0>
  <tr>
    <td>
      &nbsp;
    </td>
    <td>

Function to sync on printf, and print to a certain location.
<p>

number of characters written. </dl><dl compact><dt><b>
See also: </b><dd>
<a class="el" href="namespaceGNE_1_1Console.html#a21">mprintf</a> </dl>    </td>
  </tr>
</table>

<a name="a27" doxytag="GNE::Console::setTitle"></a><p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="2" cellspacing="0" border="0">
  <tr>
    <td class="md">
      <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0">
        <tr>
          <td class="md" nowrap valign="top"> void GNE::Console::setTitle </td>
          <td class="md" valign="top">(&nbsp;</td>
          <td class="md" nowrap valign="top">const char *&nbsp;</td>
          <td class="mdname1" valign="top" nowrap>&nbsp; <em>title</em>          </td>
          <td class="md" valign="top">)&nbsp;</td>
          <td class="md" nowrap></td>
        </tr>

      </table>
    </td>
  </tr>
</table>
<table cellspacing=5 cellpadding=0 border=0>
  <tr>
    <td>
      &nbsp;
    </td>
    <td>

<p>
Sets the title of the console window to the given parameter, where <a class="el" href="namespaceGNE.html">GNE</a> can, and where it makes sense (like Windows).
<p>
If the title cannot be set, this function does nothing. <dl compact><dt><b>
Parameters: </b><dd>
<table border=0 cellspacing=2 cellpadding=0>
<tr><td valign=top><em>title</em>&nbsp;</td><td>
the new window title </td></tr>
</table>
</dl>    </td>
  </tr>
</table>
<a name="a18" doxytag="GNE::Console::shutdownConsole"></a><p>

      </table>

  </tr>

<table cellspacing=5 cellpadding=0 border=0>
  <tr>
    <td>
      &nbsp;
    </td>
    <td>

<p>
Shuts down the console part of <a class="el" href="namespaceGNE.html">GNE</a>.
<p>
This may be called multiple times.     </td>
  </tr>
</table>
<hr><h2>Variable Documentation</h2>
<a name="a11" doxytag="GNE::Console::acquire"></a><p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="2" cellspacing="0" border="0">
  <tr>
    <td class="md">
      <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0">
        <tr>
          <td class="md" nowrap valign="top"> <a class="el" href="classGNE_1_1Console_1_1ConsoleMutex.html">ConsoleMutex</a> GNE::Console::acquire
      </table>
    </td>
  </tr>
</table>
<table cellspacing=5 cellpadding=0 border=0>
  <tr>
    <td>
      &nbsp;
    </td>
    <td>

<p>
A manipulator for gout to lock the gout output.
<p>
This does not lock other threads from writing with other <a class="el" href="namespaceGNE_1_1Console.html">Console</a> class functions, only for writing with gout. <dl compact><dt><b>
See also: </b><dd>
<a class="el" href="namespaceGNE_1_1Console.html#a12">release</a> , <a class="el" href="namespaceGNE_1_1Console.html#a9">gout</a> </dl>    </td>
  </tr>
</table>
<a name="a6" doxytag="GNE::Console::BACKSPACE"></a><p>

  <tr>
    <td class="md">
      <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0">
        <tr>
          <td class="md" nowrap valign="top"> int GNE::Console::BACKSPACE
      </table>
    </td>
  </tr>
</table>
<table cellspacing=5 cellpadding=0 border=0>
  <tr>
    <td>
      &nbsp;
    </td>
    <td>

<p>
The keycode the backspace key gives from <a class="el" href="namespaceGNE_1_1Console.html#a20">getch</a>().
<p>
<dl compact><dt><b>
See also: </b><dd>
<a class="el" href="namespaceGNE_1_1Console.html#a20">getch</a> </dl>    </td>
  </tr>
</table>

<table cellspacing=5 cellpadding=0 border=0>
  <tr>
    <td>
      &nbsp;
    </td>
    <td>

<p>
The keycode the enter key gives from <a class="el" href="namespaceGNE_1_1Console.html#a20">getch</a>().
<p>
<dl compact><dt><b>
See also: </b><dd>
<a class="el" href="namespaceGNE_1_1Console.html#a20">getch</a> </dl>    </td>
  </tr>
</table>
<a name="a10" doxytag="GNE::Console::gin"></a><p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="2" cellspacing="0" border="0">
  <tr>
    <td class="md">
      <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0">
        <tr>
          <td class="md" nowrap valign="top"> std::istream GNE::Console::gin
      </table>
    </td>
  </tr>
</table>
<table cellspacing=5 cellpadding=0 border=0>
  <tr>
    <td>
      &nbsp;
    </td>
    <td>

<p>
Similar thing with gout, but unlike gout, gin does not work in a multithreaded context.
<p>
You should use lgetString if you are doing output and input at the same time. <dl compact><dt><b>
See also: </b><dd>
<a class="el" href="namespaceGNE_1_1Console.html#a9">gout</a> </dl>    </td>
  </tr>
</table>
<a name="a9" doxytag="GNE::Console::gout"></a><p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="2" cellspacing="0" border="0">
  <tr>
    <td class="md">
      <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0">
        <tr>
          <td class="md" nowrap valign="top"> std::ostream GNE::Console::gout
      </table>
    </td>
  </tr>
</table>
<table cellspacing=5 cellpadding=0 border=0>
  <tr>
    <td>
      &nbsp;
    </td>
    <td>

<p>
An ostream that works after the console part of <a class="el" href="namespaceGNE.html">GNE</a> has been initialized.
<p>
Normally cout doesn't work after the console has been initalized. Note if you have redirected stdin or stdout then cout and cin will still work -- just not if they are writing or reading to the screen/keyboard. This is why I opted to create a separate stream from cout and cin.
<p>
Also, gout is not "quite" thread safe. There is no way to know when you ended, plus the basic_ostream that uses the streambuf may not be thread safe so, use acquire and release like a mutex if you will be using gout from multiple threads. These are not needed if using gout from a single threaded context:
<p>
gout &lt;&lt; acquire &lt;&lt; "Hello World!" &lt;&lt; x &lt;&lt; y &lt;&lt; endl &lt;&lt; release;     </td>
  </tr>
</table>
<a name="a12" doxytag="GNE::Console::release"></a><p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="2" cellspacing="0" border="0">
  <tr>
    <td class="md">
      <table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0">
        <tr>
          <td class="md" nowrap valign="top"> <a class="el" href="classGNE_1_1Console_1_1ConsoleMutex.html">ConsoleMutex</a> GNE::Console::release
      </table>
    </td>
  </tr>
</table>
<table cellspacing=5 cellpadding=0 border=0>
  <tr>
    <td>
      &nbsp;
    </td>
    <td>

<p>
A manipulator to release the gout output.
<p>
<dl compact><dt><b>
See also: </b><dd>
<a class="el" href="namespaceGNE_1_1Console.html#a11">acquire</a> , <a class="el" href="namespaceGNE_1_1Console.html#a9">gout</a> </dl>    </td>
  </tr>
</table>
